item.title: Ilana Glazer appreciates how becoming a parent forced them to draw some lines
item.description: Ilana Glazer is grateful for the limits of parenthood. On Wild Card this week, Glazer opens up about how parenthood has allowed them to draw boundaries and why they increasingly love their alone time.

item.title: Trump appoints foreign policy adviser Richard Grenell as special missions envoy
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Saturday that he's picked longtime foreign policy adviser Richard Grenell to serve as an envoy for special missions, dealing with tough foreign policy decisions.

item.title: Storms across US bring heavy snow, dangerous ice and a tornado in California
item.description: Inclement weather plagued areas of the U.S. in the first half of the weekend, with dangerous conditions including a major ice storm in Midwest states and unsual tornado activity in Central California.

item.title: Trump's tariffs threat is dividing business owners across the country
item.description: Businesses are divided over Trump's plan to impose sweeping tariffs. Some companies welcome the protection from foreign competition, while others worry about rising costs and retaliation.

item.title: ABC agrees to give $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle lawsuit
item.description: ABC News agreed to pay $15 million to Trump's presidential library to settle a lawsuit over George Stephanopoulos' inaccurate on-air assertion that Trump was found liable for raping E. Jean Carroll.

item.title: Woman who accuses Jay-Z of raping her at 13 shares new details about alleged assault
item.description: The woman said that during the alleged assault, she tried to resist but Jay-Z told her to stop. She also acknowledged some inconsistencies in her account but firmly maintained that she was attacked.
